title: Overview
content: No. 1 Wordpress GST Solution in India. Make GST Compliance Effortless for WooCommerce. Easily manage taxes and auto-generate e-invoices with WooCommerce GST Plugin.

title: Key Features
content: Here are some of the key features of our plugin: Configure GST Setting - Our WordPress GST Solution helps you to configure your GST settings. Ensures that your WooCommerce store is fully compliant with the latest GST regulations. Add Your Own TAX Slab - The plugin supports single and multiple tax slabs. Choose a single or set up multiple tax slabs (e.g., 5%, 10%, 15%) depending on products or services. Built-in Invoice Features - With this feature, you can easily generate and download GST-compliant customized invoices by adding your store logo, name, etc. GST Enabled WooCommerce - The WooCommerce GST Plugin is fully compatible with WooCommerce, so you can seamlessly enable GST compliance on your online store. Easy Upload and Install.

title: Setup Steps
content: Make GST Set-up quick and easy. Follow these simple steps for easy installation and start simplifying your tax compliance today!!! 01. Purchase plugin - Direct download from the website without any hassle and add the new plug-in into your WooCommerce enabled store. 02. Activate the plugin - The license key will be received in your email for activation. To activate the plugin, navigate to your store dashboard and add the license key in the text field. 03. Configuring tax slabs - One can add single or multiple tax slabs (5%, 10%, 15% etc), depending on the need and type of product. 04. Customize invoice - Get a customised invoice by adding your store name, logo and note in the footer which will appear in the PDF format of the invoice.

title: Reasons to Love
content: WooCommerce GST Plugin: Reason to Love it - Configure GST settings as per the norm, Dynamic tax slabs, Capture customer GSTIN Number, Customize invoice, Auto-generate PDF invoice, Get Woogst plugin now.

title: FAQ
content: Frequently asked questions: How to assign tax slab in GST Plugin? Log in to your WordPress Admin account, select WooCommerce, and click on the Settings sub-tab. Select the tool tab on the top left corner of the dashboard and enable tax rates and calculations, then access the Tax tab on the toolbar, and select GST Setting. Add your tax slabs using the select multiple tax slabs option and save your changes. Where you can use this plugin? GST is applied across all industries, whether they are service- or product-based. As long as they sell products online using the WooCommerce platform, the FMCG, pharmaceutical, and health industries, as well as those in electronics, investments, construction, etc., can all use this GST plugin. Is WooGST Plugin Pro support limited to a single domain? Although WooGST Plugin Pro is designed for use on a single domain, you can not use it on multiple domains. However, You can still use it in the local environment in addition to the production domain.

title: FAQ Features
content: Do WooGST Plugin and WooGST Plugin Pro differ in features? Yes, there are some differences in features between WooGST Plugin and WooGST Plugin Pro. WooGST Plugin Pro offers lifetime updates and one-year free support, distinguishing it from the standard WooGST Plugin. Additionally, the Pro version includes exclusive features such as custom invoice generation and HSN code support, which are not available in the basic version. What will be the invoice format? You can view/download our sample invoice.

title: Technical Support
content: Is WooCommerce GST plugin compatible with High-Performance Order Storage(HPOS)? To make the plugin compatible with the High-Performance Order Storage(HPOS) please add the below code in the given file: add_action('before_woocommerce_init', function() {if (class_exists(\Automattic\WooCommerce\Utilities\FeaturesUtil::class)) {\Automattic\WooCommerce\Utilities\FeaturesUtil::declare_compatibility('custom_order_tables', __FILE__, true);}}); Path: wp-content/plugins/woo-gst/ File Name: woocommerce-gst-addon.php

title: Pricing
content: Subscription Plans To Cater For Your Needs. Get a flexible pricing option with WooCommerce GST Plugin. Features: WooGST Plugin vs WooGST Pro. Pricing: Free Forever vs ₹4999/-. Validity: Lifetime for both. Update: Lifetime Free Update. Ticket Support: 1 Year Free Ticket Support (Pro). Admin can configure GST settings. Add their GSTIN code and which will be shown on the invoice. Can choose required tax slabs. Generates tax slabs with CGST, SGST and IGST. Able to generate PDF invoices for the order. Allow you to add HSN code for the product. Customize the invoice with your store logo, name, address etc.

title: Introduction
content: No. 1 WordPress GST Solution in India. Make GST Compliance Effortless for WooCommerce. Easily manage taxes and auto-generate e-invoices with WooCommerce GST Plugin.

title: Plugin Overview
content: WooGST Plugin helps streamline your business and simplify tax compliance with a fully GST-enabled WooCommerce store.

title: Features
content:
- Configure GST Setting â€“ Ensures your WooCommerce store is compliant with GST regulations.
- Add Your Own TAX Slab â€“ Supports single and multiple tax slabs (5%, 10%, 15%, etc.).
- Built-in Invoice Features â€“ Easily generate and download GST-compliant customized invoices with store branding.
- GST Enabled WooCommerce â€“ Fully compatible with WooCommerce.
- Easy Upload and Install â€“ Simple plugin download, license key activation, and usage.
- Product-wise GST â€“ Apply GST taxes to products based on their individual tax rates.
- Add HSN Code â€“ Allows you to add HSN codes to your products.
- Customize Invoice â€“ Add store logo, name, address, and footer notes to invoice PDFs.
- Generates tax slabs with CGST, SGST, and IGST.
- PDF Invoice Generation â€“ Auto-generate PDF invoices for each order.

title: Installation Steps
content:
- Purchase plugin â€“ Download directly from the website.
- Activate the plugin â€“ Use the license key received via email.
- Configuring tax slabs â€“ Add single or multiple tax slabs as per product type.
- Customize invoice â€“ Add store name, logo, and notes in the invoice PDF footer.

title: Support: I want the invoice date to be printed in the invoi...
content:
Question from Ravikanth Kadur: I want the invoice date to be printed in the invoice. Our despatch will be after 3 days of order. So I want the invoice date to be printed in the invoice respectively

Answer from woocommercegst: Dear Ravikanth,

Currently our plugin will take order date as invoice date. We can make this customization in code, however this will override when we release our regular plugin updates. So you need to make sure you update code every time manually. Or we can make this change permanent, however it will be charge extra with 2000 INR + GST.

Let us know which option you would like to go with.

Thank you,
Team WooGST

title: Support: Our website is on Woocommerce platform and we acce...
content:
Question from NEHAL SHAH: Our website is on Woocommerce platform and we accept payment as deposit and final amount. So woocommerce keeps a gap between any 2 ORDER IDâ€™s. Hence the next new order ID number is not in sequence. Eg: for orders with partial payment, the next order id number jumps from 4147 to 4150 to 4153 to 4156. Plus for a failed order ID, the order ID number will skip a number. But for GST compliance the Invoice number has to be in sequence, no jumps allowed, so how to manage this? How do we ensure we comply with the GST compliance for generating invoice in sequence?

Answer from John Son: Hello NEHAL, We will check and let you. Thank you, John

Answer from John Son: Hello Ramdev, Good morning 1.In the invoice still not calculating Shipping Based on Cart value % (suppose 28% item is more still default 18% is calculated) -Default woocommerce work based on the higher tax slab product in the cart, maybe it's conflicting with your Flexible Shipping plugin. 2.Need to round off the shipping Amount ( if 223.3 then need to set 223 and if 223.6 then 224) -Our plugin doesn't have a roundup option, woocommerce has a roundup option but it's not working on your site, may this will also conflicting with your Flexible Shipping plugin. 4. it displaying 28% but the calculation is done for 18% the Amount figure is displaying in Invoice -Default woocommerce work based on the higher tax slab product in the cart, maybe it's conflicting with your Flexible Shipping plugin. You can test this all the above point's on our server where it's working fine. WordPress details: http://woogst_demo.reviewtestlink.com/wp-admin User: woogst password: admin?123 Thank you, John

content:
Question from Prem Kurian Philip: Just checked it out a bit more. The tax calculates if you choose GST@5%, GST@18% etc but not if you choose GST@12%. Also for some reason the text shown after the tax is "incl VAT" which is incorrect. It should show "incl Tax". See the attached screenshot. Also, how do I set the home state to "KA"? and also what happens if people from outside KA purchase? Will the IGST be set correctly? Also, how do you handle CESS on GST?

Answer from John Son: Hello Prem, 1.The tax calculates if you choose GST@5%, GST@18% etc but not if you choose GST@12%. -It will only work for the GST@5% tac class because you have added 1 row in that tax class( https://prnt.sc/112ggyn ). But it's not working for the other 2 tax classes GST@18% and GST@12% because these tax classes are empty( https://prnt.sc/112ghiz, https://prnt.sc/112gi1d ). 2.Also for some reason the text shown after the tax is â€œincl VATâ€ which is incorrect. It should show â€œincl Taxâ€. See the attached screenshot. -It's just because you have selected including tax during cart and checkout( https://prnt.sc/112fv3j ). This is not in our scope but just for help. Add the below code into your activated theme functions.php add_filter( 'gettext', function( $translation, $text, $domain ) { if ( $domain == 'woocommerce' ) { if ( $text == '(incl. VAT)' ) { $translation = '(incl. GST)'; } } return $translation; }, 10, 3 ); 3.Also, how do I set the home state to â€œKAâ€? -We have set this for you( https://prnt.sc/112fs0i ). 4.what happens if people from outside KA purchase? Will the IGST be set correctly? -They will charge as IGST( https://prnt.sc/112gluj ), yes it will set correctly. 5.how do you handle CESS on GST? -Our plugin not handling CESS. Thank you, John

Answer from John Son: Hello Ulf Bankemper, Our plugin keep order number as invoice number unless you set invoice number series in settings. title: Support: How do I disable the PDF invoice functionality in ...
content:
Question from Deepak Dhamuria: How do I disable the PDF invoice functionality in the PRO version? I only want it's HSN, GST number feature and tax breakdown in email features, not the PDF invoice feature

Answer from John Son: Hello Deepak, We donâ€™t have an option or setting to disable the PDF invoice functionality from the admin side. Programatically we can do this only need to comment a few lines. 1.Disable from order listing. -Need to edit file plugins/woo-gst/invoice/class-gst-woocommerce-invoice.php and comment line number 30. Like this: // add_action( â€˜woocommerce_admin_order_actions_endâ€™, array( $this, â€˜add_invoice_listing_actionsâ€™ ) ); 2.Disable from order details. -Need to edit file plugins/woo-gst/invoice/class-gst-woocommerce-invoice.php and comment line number 260. Like this: // add_meta_box( â€˜woo_gst_order_pdfinvoiceâ€™, __(â€˜Order PDF Invoiceâ€™,â€™woo-gstâ€™), array($this, â€˜woo_gst_pdf_invoiceâ€™), â€˜shop_orderâ€™, â€˜sideâ€™, â€˜coreâ€™ ); 2.Disable from MY ACCOUNT orders listing. -Need to edit file plugins/woo-gst/invoice/class-gst-woocommerce-invoice.php and comment line number 48. Like this: // add_filter( â€˜woocommerce_my_account_my_orders_actionsâ€™, array($this, â€˜woo_gst_add_my_account_order_actionsâ€™), 10, 2 ); Thank you, John

title: Support: Hello Deepak, We donâ€™t have an option or setting...
content:
Question from John Son: Hello Deepak, We donâ€™t have an option or setting to disable the PDF invoice functionality from the admin side. Programatically we can do this only need to comment a few lines. 1.Disable from order listing. -Need to edit file plugins/woo-gst/invoice/class-gst-woocommerce-invoice.php and comment line number 30. Like this: // add_action( â€˜woocommerce_admin_order_actions_endâ€™, array( $this, â€˜add_invoice_listing_actionsâ€™ ) ); 2.Disable from order details. -Need to edit file plugins/woo-gst/invoice/class-gst-woocommerce-invoice.php and comment line number 260. Like this: // add_meta_box( â€˜woo_gst_order_pdfinvoiceâ€™, __(â€˜Order PDF Invoiceâ€™,â€™woo-gstâ€™), array($this, â€˜woo_gst_pdf_invoiceâ€™), â€˜shop_orderâ€™, â€˜sideâ€™, â€˜coreâ€™ ); 2.Disable from MY ACCOUNT orders listing. -Need to edit file plugins/woo-gst/invoice/class-gst-woocommerce-invoice.php and comment line number 48. Like this: // add_filter( â€˜woocommerce_my_account_my_orders_actionsâ€™, array($this, â€˜woo_gst_add_my_account_order_actionsâ€™), 10, 2 ); Thank you, John

Answer from Deepak Dhamuria: Okay Thanks

Question from Gautam Ramchandani: Hi John what is the update on the pending queries and issues

Answer from John Son: Hello Gautam, 1.Prevent the skipping of invoice no: the invoice no gets skipped in case the order fails or is canceled by the customer. -We cannot handle this programmatically, in this case, we have lots of seniors. Workaround for this is you can do this manually for a particular order or you can change Next Invoice No (or) Skip No. 2.The issue with the discount -WIP( Still looking for solution ) Thank you, John

title: Support: Hello Gautam, 1.Prevent the skipping of invoice no...
content:
Question from John Son: Hello Gautam, 1.Prevent the skipping of invoice no: the invoice no gets skipped in case the order fails or is canceled by the customer. -We cannot handle this programmatically, in this case, we have lots of seniors. Workaround for this is you can do this manually for a particular order or you can change Next Invoice No (or) Skip No. 2.The issue with the discount -WIP( Still looking for solution ) Thank you, John

Answer from Gautam Ramchandani: HI John, Changing the skip no is not possible manually, in case of multi orders in quick succession with failed or cancelled ordered in between it will not work. In fact it will create a greater issue Do speak with your seniors - Logically all that is need is once the order is processed - i.e. payment successful the invoice only gets generated at that point. What is happening currently it seems as though the invoice is getting generated at check out - In fact it should get generated at payment successful - that is the stage when the order gets placed - Look into this - ASAP Thanks

title: Support: HI John, Saw the screen shot. This means we can ad...
content:
Question from Anil Nair: HI John, Saw the screen shot. This means we can add a cess percentage in each tax class , which will be included in that tax( for eg in 18% tax class if we add, the tax percentage becomes 19%) correct? Our understanding was below 1) Cess percentage ( currently 2018 flood cess , in future kerala govt may intoduce covid cess 1% for few products) need to be added for few products. Does not depend of the tax class 2) When product is added to cart , we need to show cess percentage explicitly like GST 3) When order is created this cess should be shown in order like GST 4) In Invoice  , we need to show the cess like GST Let me know above 4 points are done.

Answer from John Son: Hello Anil, 1.Cess percentage ( currently 2018 flood cess , in future kerala govt may intoduce covid cess 1% for few products) need to be added for few products. Does not depend of the tax class -In this case, you need to create two different tax classes. 2.When product is added to cart , we need to show cess percentage explicitly like GST -Cart page: https://www.awesomescreenshot.com/image/9730963?key=3d8698610167fe5261f6e5142f5dcf9a 3.When order is created this cess should be shown in order like GST -Order page: https://www.awesomescreenshot.com/image/9731253?key=16e8d1947008226c8465d4870702c69d 4.In Invoice , we need to show the cess like GST -Please find the attachment for this. Thank you, John

Thank you, John

Answer from John Son: Hello Abhijit, Regarding Licence Key: Okay, we are allowing you to enter the same license key for 2 different domains for your testing purpose. But please let us when you have activated from your testing server. Regarding Adding Custom Fields into PDF Invoice: Yes, you can override the template using our filter 'woogst_available_invoice_templates'. If we want you to make changes and provide the custom invoice then what will be the turnaround time and charges? -Our one-time customization charges will be 3K + GST, but it depends on your custom invoice. Thank you John

Thank you, John

Answer from John Son: Dear Customer, We are apologies for delayed response. Our tech support is only available during weekday from 10AM to 7PM. Remove GST field from checkout. Are you sure you want to remove that field? because it is optional anyway. Here is CSS if you need #has_gstin_numberÂ { display : none;} If you have added HSN code for each product then HSN code will be pulled automatically in the invoices generated by WooGST Plugin To troubleshoot critical error page, you need to enable error logs on your server to see error details. it is usually bug because of incompatible server settings/environment. We will need temporary admin & FTP details to troubleshoot this issue further. Thank you, John

Answer from John Son: Dear Jayesh, As per our most use cases & customer demand we have build this intentionally because each Vendor require their invoices in sequential number as they receive the order regardless of other vendor. Thank you, John

title: Support: This is a basic invoice design..this is the actual...
content:
Question from GTC INDUSTRIES: This is a basic invoice design..this is the actual gst inovice design which is accepted by gst department so why custom? This design should be already provided by you.

Answer from John Son: Hello Team, There are multiple invoice format accepted by GST department and as a plugin provider we can not create all possible templates. Based on most common use cases & demand we have created template 3 to fulfill most of customer requirement. However, beyond that if some customer require change in template then they can hire us to create new template as per requirement with specified charges or if client (or his dev team) can use filters provided by plugin to copy & customise template 3 as per their own requirement. Thank you, John

title: Support: 1. According to the calculation in attachment issu...
content:
Question from Anek Ahuja: 1. According to the calculation in attachment issue-1.PNG , the total should be 2603, but it is 2637. 2. From the clients' analysis, theyÂ feel if the invoice is downloaded for a completed order from the admin portal, it takes the latest values of the product and not the value when the product was actually shipped. For instance, if an order was completed on 1st July and for financial analysis, if the same order invoice is downloaded now, it reflects the current value of the items. [Value of items will change depending on the market needs] This also creates lots of confusion during reconciliation. 3. According to our finance suggestion, the client needs to see the following table in the invoice. This will make it clearerÂ to the user. title: Support: "Product wise GST One can configure the different ...
content:
Question from Mritunjay Kumar: "Product wise GST One can configure the different tax slab depending on the type of product as per the GST norms." I was thinking that this feature is working for our requirement. But sorry to say that this is confusing. it is not working on product category. So, i have no need this plugin. Request to you please cancel our license and refund amount to us. Thanks .

Answer from John Son: Dear Mritunjay, Thank you for reaching back to us. As mentioned in our Terms & Condition, As a nature of digital product we do not offer the refund. As mentioned on website that feature it about assigning tax product wise so you have open control to configure the tax per product & not the category wise. If you want to assign tax in bulk you can do that using default woocommerce product export/import feature. Our pro plugin basically provide more features like invoice generation, invoice attachment via email etc. If you need any assistance related to plugin usage you can also follow our documentation https://woocommercegstcoin.stage.site/documentation/ Thank you, John

title: Support: Hi ok, Do you have a tutorial or steps that we can...
content:
Question from Galaxy Industrial Corporation: Hi ok, Do you have a tutorial or steps that we can refer to? WR, Ankur

Answer from John Son: Hello Team, We don't have a tutorial for this. This is woocommerce default functionality to import the product CSV. Steps 1. In the CSV column, you can enter the Tax class in the Tax class column Steps 2. In the CSV column, you can enter the HSN Code in Meta: hsn_prod_id column Steps 3. From here you can import the CSV https://prnt.sc/1s0scn5 Thank you, John

That's why it also does not apply to the order as well( https://prnt.sc/1sxu50f ). You have inserted a row below the "Standard" tax rates that will not work. Answer from John Son: Hello Aruna, I suspect that you are using PHP 8.0, is that correct? The PDF library that we use is not compatible with PHP 8.0 yet. Generally speaking, I would recommend sticking with PHP 7.4 for a couple of months until all systems are compatible â€“ as you can see we too are tied to third-party libraries that need to be updated. Let me know if you solve this issue! Thank you, John

Answer from John Son: HelloÂ Angela, 1. To hide admin invoice listing actions: Comment below line from the file class-gst-woocommerce-invoice.php add_action( 'woocommerce_admin_order_actions_end', array( $this, 'add_invoice_listing_actions' ) ); File path: wp-content/plugins/woo-gst/invoice/class-gst-woocommerce-invoice.php Line number: 30 2. To hide customer invoice listing actions: Comment below line from the file class-gst-woocommerce-invoice.php add_filter( 'woocommerce_my_account_my_orders_actions', array($this, 'woo_gst_add_my_account_order_actions'), 10, 2 ); File path: wp-content/plugins/woo-gst/invoice/class-gst-woocommerce-invoice.php Line number: 58 Thank you, John

title: Support: Hi, Documentation link is of single plugin not mul...
content:
Question from Shashank Sejpal: Hi, Documentation link is of single plugin not multivendor. So please help me with some of the details even if we discussed it on call: If vendor buys subscription. Will my gst number show on invoice? Please check the attached photo. Are the settings configured correctly? Including Indian tax slabs? (Not sure if I am supposed to sum up cgst and sgst or have to keep it separate) Dont remember what we discussed yesterday on this, am I supposed make Manual invoices for commission being charged to vendors?

Answer from John Son: Hello Shashank , Here is the documentation link for WooCommerce GST PRO addon for Dokan: https://woocommercegstcoin.stage.site/dokan-addon-documentation 1.If vendor buys subscription. Will my gst number show on invoice? -Yes Shop GSTIN number will be reflect on the invoice. 2.Please check the attached photo. Are the settings configured correctly? Including Indian tax slabs? (Not sure if I am supposed to sum up cgst and sgst or have to keep it separate) -From here you can just create single or multiple tax slab according to the store state. -From the Tax tab( https://prnt.sc/OjgUsz9n661Y ) you can setup product price inclusive of tax or exclusive of tax. 3.Dont remember what we discussed yesterday on this, am I supposed make Manual invoices for commission being charged to vendors? -Need to check dokan seeting for this, we will update you on this ASAP. Thank you, John

content:
Question from ZSK APPARELS PRIVATE LIMITED: Hi I want to have 12% IGST when the order is above 1000 rs. and 5% IGST when order is below 1000 rs and that will be per product price. For ex. If a customer adds two product (A and B) in cart in which product A total price in cart is 1200rs and product B total price 600rs, so the GST plugin should work  as 12% GST for cart A product and 5% GST as cart B product. How to do this

title: Support: and if customer order 100 qty of 2rs product then ...
content:
Question from ZSK APPARELS PRIVATE LIMITED: and if customer order 100 qty of 2rs product then it totals as 200rs so the gst should be 5%

Answer from John Son: Hello Team, As per woocomerce standard you can apply only one tax class at a time to the product. Tax class will apply based on the tax class assigned to the product not based on your amount slab. Thank you, John

I don't think the concept of e-invoice is clear with Stark Digital. E-Invoicing is mandatory for companies in India above a certain revenue threshold. It is a direct link between the seller and the government where a product once sold and the invoice generated, the same invoice reflects in the Government Portal. This has been done to prevent any frauds or cheating and ensuring clear tax payments. (Strongly recommended you educate yourself and your team about the local laws) This can be done via a simple API and many other stores like Shopify are offering this for free. We are happy to offer you the API and it simply needs to be added to the plugin!! Infact you should be paying me for educating the entire Stark Digital Team about the grave laws they are breaking by selling an incorrect plugin. In case you are successful in doing the API integration. I am making it abundantly clear that Stark Digital will be liable to pay me for helping them develop a software that is mandatory for Indian Laws. It is solely me who has pointed this out to stark digital and its team. What is the point of charging 3000 INR PER YEAR when your plugin does not comply with the     local mandatory laws. Please suggest ways forward. GST â€“ E Invoice | National Informatics Centre (www.nic.in) - E-Invoice E-way Bill Rules in GST | Tally Solutions - E-way Bill

title: Support: We needed some other clarification. Can we speak w...
content:
Question from Gautam: We needed some other clarification. Can we speak with some on that. For example. The invoice should only be generated one the customer has made the payment. In case the clients payment does not get processed / the client decides not to buy after checkout before payment. Then the invoice should not be generated and the sequence on the invoices should not get effect. kindly advice on this. thanks

Answer from John Son: Hello Gautam, For every single order, the invoice is generated irrespective of the order status. The ID sequence of the invoice is maintained based on the order hence invoice ID can not be skipped. Let us know if is there anything else we can help you with. Regards, John

'/' . $invoice_number; return $custom_invoice_number; } // Hook into WooCommerce to replace default invoice numbers add_filter('woocommerce_order_number', 'custom_invoice_number');

title: Support: PDF invoice. "Error trying to generate document: C...
content:
Question from Swaroopa Utgi: PDF invoice. "Error trying to generate document: Call to a member function length_in_pt() on null" Could you check if it's related to our plugin? If yes, could you please resolve it?

Answer from John Son: Hello Swaroopa, We've addressed the plugin compatibility issue by updating our plugin's code. To apply the fix, please follow these steps: Navigate to the following location on your server: /wp-content/plugins/woo-gst/invoice/class-gst-woocommerce-invoice.php . Locate the line of code that reads require_once "vendor/autoload.php"; . Replace that line of code with the following: if (!class_exists('WPO_WCPDF')) { require_once "vendor/autoload.php"; } This change ensures that the autoloader is only loaded if the WPO_WCPDF class is not already defined. After making this modification, save the file, and the compatibility issue should be resolved. Thank you Regards, John

Answer from John Son: Hello Naman, Weâ€™ve addressed the plugin compatibility issue by updating our pluginâ€™s code. To apply the fix, please follow these steps: Navigate to the following location on your server: /wp-content/plugins/woo-gst/invoice/class-gst-woocommerce-invoice.php. Locate the line of code that reads require_once "vendor/autoload.php";. Replace that line of code with the following: if (!class_exists('WPO_WCPDF')) { require_once "vendor/autoload.php"; } This change ensures that the autoloader is only loaded if the WPO_WCPDF class is not already defined. After making this modification, save the file, and the compatibility issue should be resolved. Thank you Regards, John

title: Support: I have recently purchased the GST plugin from wooc...
content:
Question from Mahesh Vanneldas: I have recently purchased the GST plugin from woocommercegst.co.in and installed it on my website. Purchased and installed the GST plugin as per the documentation. On my website I received order from Billing Address: Bengaluru, Karnataka Shipping Address: Bengaluru, Karnataka My company located at Maharashtra According to the GST rules, the invoice should reflect IGST since the shipping and billing address are both in Karnataka, while my company is based in Maharashtra. However, the invoice is incorrectly showing CGST and SGST instead of IGST. Expected Outcome: The invoice should display IGST as per the interstate transaction rules. Actual Outcome: The invoice displays CGST and SGST instead of IGST. Please assist in resolving this issue as it is critical for the correct functioning of GST invoicing on my website. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. Regards, Mahesh

Answer from John Son: Hello Mahesh, Are the tax slabs assigned to the product correctly which user has ordered. Can you please check this and revert back? Also Can you please attach invoice copy for that order so that our devloper team can check Regards, John

And please share me list of State codes and what should be the priority. In my case, Maharashtra is the state the my company registered at and for this 12% tax slab please explain me example. FOR CGST & SGST each 6% for interstate will be shown but 12% for rest of the states out side Maharashtra, how to exclude maharashtra from here. This is not covered in the installation document as well.

title: Support: Please let us know if there is any solution or a w...
content:
Question from Kaberi Das: Please let us know if there is any solution or a work around. We don't want to change the funnel that is working for us just for an additional feature of GSTIN input. Also, please provide us an update on the first point of the previous message regarding the admin email in the invoice.

Answer from John Son: Hello Kaberi, I wanted to bring to your attention that the GSTIN field is available on the default WooCommerce checkout page, as illustrated in the following screenshot: Screenshot . You can check it in Pages > Checkout > click on edit with Elementor However, since you are using the Funnel Kit store checkout template, it overrides the default WooCommerce checkout page, which is causing the issue. I understand that you prefer not to change the template, but please note that the GSTIN feature is integrated with the default WooCommerce checkout and enables users to enter their GSTIN number when placing an order. This could be quite useful for you. If you choose to keep the current template, I recommend consulting with your developer to explore potential workarounds. We are happy to assist with this if needed. Additionally, regarding the email field on the invoice template: please note that it is a generic template. Customizations will incur an additional charge. You may either hire a developer for this or make the changes yourself. Best regards, John

title: Support: Thank you for reaching out. It looks like the GST ...
content:
Question from John Son: Thank you for reaching out. It looks like the GST is being reflected in the booking emails from the dashboard. This could be due to the WooCommerce GST plugin settings or a customization in your email templates. We recommend checking the following steps to resolve the issue: 1.WooCommerce GST Plugin Settings : Go to your WordPress Admin Dashboard â†’ WooCommerce â†’ Settings â†’ GST. Ensure that the GST calculation settings are configured correctly based on your store's location and taxation rules. 2.Email Template Customization : Check if there are any customizations in the WooCommerce email templates that might be displaying the GST. You can go to WooCommerce â†’ Settings â†’ Emails , and from there, select the specific email template that handles order details or booking confirmations. If you find any customizations, you can reset them to default or modify them as needed. 3.WooCommerce Tax Settings : Navigate to WooCommerce â†’ Settings â†’ Tax , and verify that the tax options, including GST, are set as per your business requirements. If you don't want GST to appear in the booking email, you can configure tax display options to exclude taxes in customer-facing emails. 4.Check for Plugin Conflicts : Sometimes, other plugins can interfere with the tax settings. You can temporarily disable other plugins (especially those related to bookings, invoicing, or customizations) and check if the issue persists. If you're unsure about any of the above steps, please let me know, and I'll be happy to assist further.

Answer from John Son: HiÂ Sindhu We have reviewed the issue you raised regarding the GSTIN number not appearing on the invoice. Upon investigation, we found that the High-Performance Order Storage (HPOS) option was enabled in your WooCommerce settings under WooCommerce > Advanced > Features. This option is currently incompatible with the WooCommerce Legacy REST API, which may have affected the invoice generation. https://prnt.sc/VTuCODspC3YI To resolve this, we have switched the order data storage setting back to WordPress posts storage (legacy), which is compatible with the Legacy REST API. Additionally, we have ordered two products from your site for testing purposes to ensure everything is functioning as expected after the changes. Please let us know if you need any further assistance or have any questions. Thank You John

title: Support: Hello Sarath, We have added functionality for temp...
content:
Question from John Son: Hello Sarath, We have added functionality for template-3 to your WooCommerce GST plugin.https://prnt.sc/uMPdaaPnwEom Please follow the steps below to implement the required code changes: 1. File Name: woo-gst>invoice>templates>class-template3.php Update Needed: Replace the code on line 40: $invoice_prefix_number = str_replace('_', ' ', $invoice_prefix); with the following code: $invoice_prefix_number = str_replace('_', '', $invoice_prefix); https://prnt.sc/5Kt6meUMGTn9 This change ensures that any underscores in the invoice prefix are removed. 2. File Name: woo-gst>invoice>class-gst-woocommerce-invoice.php Update Needed: Replace the following code on line 472 : $pdf_get = woo_gst_get_invoice_name($o_id); // Output the generated PDF to Browser $filename = 'invoice-'.$pdf_get; with this updated code: $pdf_get = woo_gst_get_invoice_name($o_id); $clean_pdf_get = str_replace('_', '', $pdf_get); // Remove underscores // Output the generated PDF to Browser $filename = 'invoice-' . $clean_pdf_get; https://prnt.sc/RhAwWVBGwDk5 This ensures that the generated invoice PDF file names do not contain any underscores. These changes will apply the necessary adjustments for template-3 functionality. Once updated, the invoice filenames will be formatted correctly without any unwanted characters. If you have any questions or need further assistance, please don't hesitate to reach out. Best regards, John

title: Support: Hello, where can I find and how I can setup TCS an...
content:
Question from Manjinder Singh Balgir: Hello, where can I find and how I can setup TCS and TDS deductions with GST Pro plugin.

Answer from John Son: Hello Manjinder , Thank you for reaching out to us regarding the Woo GST Plugin. Our WooCommerce GST Plugin is specifically designed to streamline GST compliance by: Assigning tax slabs (CGST, SGST, IGST) during the initial setup. Generating PDF invoices with GSTIN numbers. Maintaining accurate records for tax filing. The plugin ensures efficient handling of a large volume of orders, making it ideal for businesses managing complex tax slabs. It focuses on GST-related features and does not currently support TCS (Tax Collected at Source) or TDS (Tax Deducted at Source) deductions. For further details on our plugin's features and setup, please refer to our documentation here: Documentation: https://woocommercegstcoin.stage.site/documentation/ If you have additional questions or need further assistance, feel free to reach out. Best regards, John

title: Support: Hi Team, I want to start invoice number from 001 b...
content:
Question from Umesh Chudasama: Hi Team, I want to start invoice number from 001 but it's showing wocommerce default order number. How to set invoice number starting from 001.

Answer from John Son: Hello Umesh, Thank you for reaching out to us. You can set the starting invoice number by entering the desired number in the Next Invoice No or Skip No field. For example, if you enter "001" in Next Invoice No or Skip No , the first invoice number will be "001." However, please note that subsequent invoice numbers will increment by 1, meaning the next invoice will be "2" and not "002." This is the default functionality of the plugin. If you require "00" in the invoice number, you can add it in the Invoice Prefix field. For instance, entering a prefix like "SO/24-25/ 00". Please let us know if you have further questions or need assistance with this setup. Thank you, John

Answer from John Son: Hi Nihar, To view and download the PDF invoices for your orders, please follow these steps: Go to WooCommerce > Orders in your WordPress dashboard. On the top-right corner of the page, click on Screen Options . In the panel that appears, make sure the "Actions" checkbox is selected. Answer from Nihar Soni: Hi Nihar, Thank you for reaching out. Please find the responses to your queries below: 1. Shipping email not visible on the invoice In the screenshot you provided, the email address is missing under the shipping details. ???? To add a custom email to the invoice, we recommend following our Developer Guide for code-based customization. Kindly request your developer to refer to the documentation here: Developer Guide Documentation 2. Unable to change the invoice number If you are trying to change the invoice number and it doesnâ€™t get saved, please note: ???? After updating the invoice number, you must place a new order for the changes to take effect. The updated number will only reflect in new invoices generated after saving. 3. Order note not visible on the invoice Currently, order notes are not displayed on our invoice template by default. ???? If youâ€™d like to include order notes on the invoice, this can be done through custom code. Please refer your developer to our Developer Guide: Developer Guide Documentation 4. Want to show different phone number and email for shipping (e.g. sending a gift) We noticed from your attached invoice that the billing and shipping details are the same. ???? To enable different contact information for shipping (such as in gift scenarios), please ensure that the shipping address, phone number, and email are entered separately during checkout. If you wish to further customize your invoice layout or add additional fields like phone or email in the shipping section, you may either: Follow our Developer Guide for code-level customization, or Reach out to us if youâ€™d like our team to implement the changes for you. Please note that customization services are chargeable. Let us know how youâ€™d like to proceed, and weâ€™ll be happy to assist further.
